#Text=I 'd like to wait a little while with defining what a next project would look like .
#Text=Given the constraints of " organizing projects to improve open source development " , we might have not much choice either .

column1: #Text=It would probably mean to work with a new team each time , so most likely be based on shorts only .
#Text=On the other hand , there 's also clear signals that this approach works well , and creates excitement and involvement of a lot of people , also from producers and sponsors .
#Text=That might enable us to set up a next project based on larger targets .
#Text=For a full-length feature film however , we should involve a sufficient amount of experienced film makers as well , and/or invite the first team to participate again .
#Text=That would put a lot of pressure on the required budget … .
#Text=You ca n't do that based on a 1000 DVD pre-sale target .
#Text=Would more be like 20,000 or so … . : )
#Text=How did the process of making the movie feed back into the development of Blender ?
#Text=Are there major technical changes that were made only or primarily because of the film ?
#Text=Already during the pre-production phase the artists have defined the key targets for Blender development .
#Text=This then was coordinated with the online development community too .
#Text=I 've done the most crucial ( re-)development mostly myself , though .
#Text=Especially on the character animation tools , on the rendering pipeline and compositing tools .
#Text=It is especially the latter I 'm most satisfied with .
#Text=In 3D movie production the compositing stage creates a giant content bottleneck .
#Text=By transparently integrating this in our render-pipeline , a very efficient workflow has been achieved .
#Text=And , not to forget , Blender now also offers the first production-level open source compositor on the market !
#Text=The current summary you can find in our work-in-progress release notes .
#Text=What are the key technical features in Blender you want to add or improve for future movie projects ?
#Text=Depends on what the movie is about !
#Text=There 's always hundreds of features you can work on .
#Text=However , we 'll have to work on that anyway , movie project or not .
#Text=There 's a lot of professionals using Blender now , and they ca n't wait for the Blender Foundation to do movies !
#Text=Look at this studio for example :
#Text=http://www.plumiferos.com/
#Text=I read that at least one proprietary software package , Reaktor , was used for the sound effects .
#Text=Is this because no equivalent free software solution exists yet ?
#Text=Will future projects have a " free software only " policy ?

column1: #Text=We 've limited the " Open Source tools " requirement to our own Studio Orange only .
#Text=That was what we could keep in control at least , and I can tell you it was not always easy even ... : )
#Text=For sound and music we 've decided from the beginning to seek an external sponsor .
#Text=We have chosen to work with the best quality studio and composer we could find , preferably using open source , but not as a prerequisite .
